response.value:
The aim of this report is to provide details of two mediums of transportation that students used the most. In the report, there are the advantages and disadvantages of each means and some recommendations to solve problems on moving for students.

Most popular transport for students is bike. Student tend to go to school by bike as it brings many benefits. Firstly, moving by bike is one of actions that help to protect the environment. Secondly, many students choose cycling to improve their health. In addition, bike is a cheap vehicle, thus, it is suitable for students. On the other hand, there are also some drawbacks from transfer by bike. Firstly, there are no safe places for bike. Secondly, moving by is slower than other mediums. Thirdly, students need to change their clothes after cycling.

Second most popular transport is train. There are reasons why students like transfer by train. Firstly, trains is a medium that good for environment. Secondly, it is quicker than the other vehicle. In addition, there are many stations in the city, hence, they can catch the station near their home to go to school. Despite these benefits, there are some disadvantages form moving by trains. Train ticket is expensive for students, especially those who stay far away from school. Sometimes, train has been cancelled or lated which makes students might late or absent their classes. In rush hour, there are huge people in train, it is uncomfortable for students.

There are some recommendations can resolve these problems for moving by bike. The solutions would be the University should have organise a secured place for students to place their bikes during class time and a changing room for students when they arrive the campus by bike. For moving by train, there are some recommendations can prevent these drawbacks. The University can starts lesson later to avoid rush hour. In addition, the university can support their students on their transfer budget or help them get discount on train tickets.
